Don't order the Hatake  expecting white scallops.   They were brown with the outside mussel intact.   For an ayce sushi there are better  places.   It was decent but not great.   I don't think I will return or recommend it to anyone.

0GuSMv3FgKgu5k5ZNo1xyg.text: the food, and atmosphere here are very good. unfortunately that's where the good ends. a friend and i ate here last night, and the wait times to get an order out are not even in the ball park for acceptable! we were there for over an hour and managed to get two, YES TWO orders in that time! this is the only AYCE sushi experience i have ever had where i left still hungry. after waiting all that time for two orders, we gave up and ordered dessert. one came out about ten minutes before the other, and when the other dessert managed to find it's way on to the table it did't even come with a spoon! so i guess the wait staff wants their guests to eat dessert with dirty chopsticks as they were the only utensils i had. at that point we got up! shame on sushi neko! this place did not deliver on any level other then taste. ohh and they still charged full price for a very incomplete meal!

W-pqBM1k1brwgVGwjuPGWw.text: We came on a Friday night around 6:30 pm. it wasn't very busy. Service was speedy and friendly. There was always someone walking around filling our waters. The food was good and $25 for a AYCE dinner is not bad at all. The honey toast for dessert is a must try. I would definitely be back.

NU0IkL-RuHW6-FTT-lZROQ.text: Sushi to rice ratio is AMAZING! My husband and I always come here all the time! This is the only sushi place we will ever go to now. I don't get why people would go to Goyemon. The service is so much better compared to Goyemon and the sushi is much bigger and way fresher. If you like to eat lots of nigiris, this is the place to go. Thumbs up for Neko!

3c4jm3HWzeSQYr32HRFb6Q.text: About a month ago we came here for dinner, one of costumer at table across from us got a b-day server bring out a mini cake with candle to the table and sing happy b-day song. At that moment i really like experience how the restaurant do that to b-day costumer, in my head thinking that i will come back here for dinner and celebrate b-day. Today we came back here and is my girl b-day, almost at the end servers come and ask us for desert, so we pick a mini cake b-day it only give out to b-day person only!! Server ask to see ID to make sure is really my girl b-day, so we all excited and waiting for mini cake with candle to sing a happy b-day song. Server walk to our table with mini cake and said " here is your desert " with out a candle and walk away immediately. What is the point of asking for ID??? What server bring us look like ice cream with whip cream on top, it that what they call a mini cake????  So i walk to cashier ask do you do anything for b-day?? He said yes we bring out mini cake with candle and sing happy b-day. Server listen to what ask the cashier and bring out a candle and ask " do we want her to light the candle" ?? And walk away. Today is really bad b-day experience for us. Thank you..

6KR690ujE1hu5FlNUZRmlQ.text: This place is so good. Strip quality but at neighborhood prices. Best AYCE in town! Super fresh. I've been a couple times and it's consistently good. The cut of fish is much bigger than the rice unlike most AYCE places. It's super cute inside great decor and atmosphere. Making this my go to sushi place.

17trW6H6SEAOp2FH7Q10tA.text: Super slow service. Worst part of this all you can eatrestaurant is the drinks are not refilable, and you can only have 1 dessert. So if you want mochi ice cream you can't order the order dessert anymore. Not coming back.

jVsg3TXjJCupsBEJ0j40uA.text: Every time we go the food is amazing. The service is great. And the atmosphere is great. Highly recommend any one to go and check it out. Can't wait for the remodel to be done so we can go back.

hS3OImYSU94181oKofzsYA.text: My kids love this place, if You hate your rice in sushi this is the place to go! Their sushi taste fresh good choices and not so much rice. We love the ambiance, the service is a little slow, the girl giving us water gets five star, the waitress seemed uninterested takes our order then forget stuff. We still go here for AYCE.

DaCFjDQ_SCfyO1knr3YLSA.text: My husband and I have tried probably every all-you-can eat sushi restaurant in town & this new spot is by far THE BEST! Raw fish is very fresh & service is 5-star! We also met the chef & he let us try some special rolls! We found our new fav sushi spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gJRwZH0XOUB_Cxjqa7oiNQ.text: This place is super adorable with a cat theme. It is owned by sakana so the sushi is good. But the rice is super small which is awesome but when we order something we would never get it because the chef would forget or they would have it. The fish is super good. I enjoy that they do have no rice option so you aren't  so full of rice but the portions are great. Just a lot of miscommunication, I suppose or something happened to cause us not to everything we order. We felt bad for the servers because they wouldn't know what happened to our orders. I mean we were missing a lot of orders. But it's okay. It was a interesting experience. This guy gave us some cup for all the missing orders which was sweet. But regardless we would come back! and hopefully they have everything on the menu next time we visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IkzZzgYp1_S6jpmGekmTVg.text: I'm already biased based on their other store Sakana. Had a bad experience in Seattle with sushi so had to make it up here. Place is nicely decorated for a fun filled atmosphere. Service is top notch. We even met a guy that had transfered over from sakana. Overall food was top notch as well. The sashimi is fresh. The rolls we didn't order that many as we were there for nigri more.  Most def a place to check out.

pfF47avjbzF4XAsMyQlOXA.text: I wanted sushi today with a friend and my boyfriend on this lovely day. I went into sushi Neko due to the fact that it was close by. I went in and we all ordered all you can eat. We each ordered water, the water was not only dirty but two glasses were evidently not washed. When the sushi came the sushi was majority fish with minimal rice, making it hard to use chopsticks because the rolls would just fall apart because the nori couldn't seal closed. The deserts were so-so, my honey toast was amazing but my Italian boyfriend who has grown up eating tiramisu said that it was very dry and seemed as if it had been left out for a day or two, my friend had the green tea ice cream which came complete with a piece of blueish plastic in the ice cream.  Our bill was $68. I paid $45 in cash, leaving my friend with a $23 bill which was to be charged to her card. When we received our receipts she had been charged $42 and I was told that I had only put $26 in cash with the check. Originally the busser picked up our check, I do not know if he had stolen the $20 bill before he gave it to the waitress or what happened but somehow my $20 bill disappeared into thin air and my friend was over charged by $20. The host was also rude when seating us, making a comment about us being impatient when I had told my friend that I was so hungry, I was not only not speaking to the host but my comment was meant to portray my excitement about trying this new sushi restaurant to my friend and boyfriend. My boyfriend has also worked as a busser, food runner, server, bartender, and restaurant manager for 6 years, he was very upset with the experience as a whole. The treatment we recieved from the staff was far from acceptable, the food was sub-par, much of if tasting somewhat fishy and not very fresh, the rolls were falling apart, and we waited over ten minutes to receive our water after only two of us were asked what we would have liked. My boyfriend would have preferred a sprite but was never given the opportunity to order and tried twice to get the waitresses attention for long enough to ask but she did not seem concerned with anything other than getting to her next table. Do not come here, go anywhere else in the Las Vegas valley and I guarantee you won't regret not trying this place, you aren't missing out, if anything you are just saving yourself grief and heartache

U9BnGj3cWm-j28v8VoV4Xw.text: Sushi is nice and fresh very friendly atmosphere. To many choices so good. Literally 100 sushi choices this place lives up to the other reviews I've read more than a five star sushi place great location awesome staff!

Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W_BCbQ_DjjRSogs-V5387w.text: This sushi place is me and my husband's favorite spot in Chinatown. The rice to sashimi portion is perfect. There are a couple items on the menu that is dinner only and just one order per person. Everything on the menu is very good. The only downside to this place is that sometimes the service can be hit or miss. There was one time me and my husband wasn't sat down in order of who came in first and how small our party was. There was a big party that came in after us and got greeted right away and sat down right away. That kind of got us mad. I didn't feel like I was welcomed to this place after we've been coming here for so many times. Once we got sat down, my husband wanted to tell the manager that we weren't expecting top of the line service but just to let them know that some of their servers has been playing favorites with the customers and getting special treatments because the customers are friends with the server. To be honest, I heard the customer/server speaking in Korean. I was so tempted to speak in Korean so that they knew that understood everything and that I knew what was going on. But I didn't want to cause a scene. So being nice and polite, my husband talked to the manager and told him what had happened. He said he was really sorry that this had to happened to us and that he greatly appreciates our business. The next time we went in to have our dinner, we noticed that that the service was a lot more better.my husband and I are never the type to complain about anything. If we have to bring something up to a manager we would just politely ask to speak to them and not yell at our server.

ljRrY9LUFrNyCA2PV2LvPw.text: Im gonna rate everything by stars.  Food quality ***** Price ***** Service *  Total 3.6 stars  This place must be new.  The servers are having a very very hard time getting the orders from chef to table.  Last time i was there food was everywhere.  So many lost orders.  So many of other peoples orders to our table.    If you get to read this mr owner at sushi neko.  Use a table numbering system.  Number the tables.  Whenever someone orders put that number on the order form so when the chef makes it you know which table the food goes to.  Love the business.  The cashier girl is very very beautiful.  Lucky man married her.  Anyways.  Great food.  If this place had better orginization it will easily be the best in las vegas.

g2bFOC4ZykQiUedBVtjYoA.text: I love this place so much. I always get the ayce here. The fish is always fresh and their set up is amazing. The rolls come out quick and the flavor of the sauces on the sushi is awesome. The nigiri sushi is delicious. I love to order salmon belly or salmon and the white albacore is bomb.com, it's great cause you can wrap the sushi around the rice, it's not like other places where there's barely any fish. The taste of the rice is good in the sushi too. The rolls are always neat and the waiters or waitresses we get always upbeat. I love the decor and the little Japanese movies/anime they have on. My only complaint is that I wish they would open later!!

YvRNx3n8K7-WQIl0LHJ0LA.text: Great quality, tons of fish to rice ratio, usually not that busy. We brought our baby and got a booth. Great drink specials

NuGTn8ZY_4YmIcRjTDqJhw.text: Rude host turned us away an hour before closing time. Said it was last call at 11:05pm . Won't be back.

lIQXyovipbdqpys_F5GB9A.text: Came in here with a group of 12 people. Service was spot on from Carlos. Sat in the small room to right as you enter which was a little weird as it seems like there was a wall there before that they just took down the dry wall. Hard to maneuver chairs for those sitting in them that were against some of the 2x4's. I would recommend taking them down if they can. All the food was great. Never got any photos since we scarfed it down as soon as it hit the table. I've been to Sakana a few times & I believe that Sushi Neko is better.

hItyUecxSioHCjqRoZkhBg.text: AMAZING!  Best bang for your buck when it comes to sushi places around the area. If you're ever in china town, stop by and don't leave without trying "The Shit", it definitely lives up to its name! :)

_MgIPISgB1mpFpYiwFEiGQ.text: This place was bomb. We came in late on Tuesday night as a kind of last minute thing. No one was in the restaurant and we learned that it had only been open for a few weeks.   We came in as a party of four and were immediately seated. The first thing that I noticed about the restaurant was how clean and vibrant it looked. The decor on the walls reflects a Japanese theme (as sushi restaurants generally), but with a pop culture twist.   Our servers Carlos and Hana were very knowledgeable about the menu and explained everything well. They offered great suggestions and followed thru on several of them. We had a smattering of rolls, ranging from the mundane tiger roll to the succulent Chanel roll. My personal favorite was the shit however. I'll let you figure that out on your own.   For 25.95 for dinner, I would definitely come back. Probably even tomorrow. Found a new good place that is excellent.

fTplnJANqOa4ByOvNmDYlw.text: Great little hidden gem!  I was told about this place it really is kinda hidden in the corner of the plaza.  Great, fun atmosphere, well lit and staff are very friendly l, attentive and kept the sushi coming. We ordered the all you can eat sushi.  Lots of different items to choose from and the flavors did not dissapoint. So delicious!!  Will recommend and return.

Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm

dSR47V1DmkdSz_FSGBHQuQ.text: First time here and wont be my last. If u are coming to Vegas and want ayce I recommend this place! Amazing service and food!

0Hly6_XivNEIuzjJz92-zg.text: $25.95 for all you can eat sushi, pretty good price! Lots of options to chose from. The fish to rice ratio was good ! And we enjoyed the few Korean options too. The service was friendly and fast.

qZZFmOUx9nj5qSvGfRWIDQ.text: This was my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant for the last year, and I have recommended this place to so many people. However during my last visit, I brought some out-of-town relatives here for dinner and was left embarrassed for talking this place up so much.   Normally, as many other reviewers have mentioned, the rice to fish ratio is great. However, during this visit, I received sushi with double (or more) the regular amount of rice. I'm unsure if this is due to a new chef or new procedures. I guess we'll see?  While it's not noted on the menu, our server told us (rather rudely btw) that each table is limited to 2 orders of kama (collar). Doesn't matter if your table is 2 people or 20. Only 2 per table. So we ordered 2. 30 minutes later, we were informed there was no Kama left. Come to think of it, I don't think they've ever had it in stock when I dined there.   To add some variety, we also wanted to order the tonkatsu on their special menu. Then we were told that they do not make that item anymore. A little disappointing. Anyway, if this is the direction Sushi Neko and all of their sister restaurants are going, then I may need to consider finding a new favorite.

79cooAzcJAY2sEvUJKakHA.text: Best sushi place. Fresh & a lot of selections. Very clean and the staffs are super attentive.

phjDfKWvrNxT0HQ0U7s0kw.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. All you can eat with a variety of sushi, from simple dishes to spicy dishes. Also that it is open to midnight, I can head here at any time

TuHhRN9nRkmlil83rB6MFA.text: This will be my new go to place for sushi! I trusted Yelp and man did it not disappoint! We did all you can eat sushi and everything tasted so fresh. We ordered son of a beach, lemon salmon, Yuzu yellow tail, the shit (yes that's what's it called), pang, ocean trout, and more. I'll be dreaming of this place when I'm back home in Los Angeles.

R3GFZr895CbpcaUgf72RQQ.text: This place is awesome! The rolls and hand rolls are top notch! Super white tuna! Boom! Will definitely come back next time in Vegas.

SxGAgtLkq79GkSMdLLaeUA.text: The sushi here is the best! Delicious! Service is great too! Lots of energy! The food is fat too. We just sat down an ordered and the food is already here.

uPBRRgxbMTSFGvPmpCl98A.text: Awesome place! This is our second time here. The food is great! The waitress is friendly and helpful.

y21p1cOWKQ5OOt05d6-wkw.text: Second time here, Love the AYCE selection. The nigiri is on point, The amount of rice to fish is how it should be, more fish than rice. Everything was tasty Garlic Tuna all day! Only thing some of us said was the Ikura (salmon eggs) and Uni seemed a little old but good. Great service both times, waters were filled and orders were taken promptly. Be back again in the future

gfDR_W36_FJUH5FJy93bYw.text: I LOVED everything about this place. The fish was the freshest I've ever had in an all you can eat sushi restaurant. The service was so good ! We had two people coming around the check on us the second they saw we had empty plates. Our water was never empty. They had iPads putting in our order and sending it to the back. Neko will take first on my list. Sorry Goyemon.  I was just there last night and I already want to go back !

9HO5swrs7RSvcp7_AwK68A.text: Been here so many times and have never been disappointed!!  I recommend the lobster king roll, it's so good.

LGqaws6tAabswcxUsBiCaQ.text: This is my favorite place to go for ayce sushi. I've been coming here the past 5 years or so. It never disappoints. I love getting the nigiri because the fish is always fresh . The service is always so good. The staff super friendly !

xPV8LzGg2fGj25xkPu_8LQ.text: Great place for sushi wonderful people really good atmosphere the beat in town next time you in chinatown its a must visit

fz3bXYeLJ2L5rop9zpzQfA.text: Tell me why this place isn't rated 5 stars!?!   For years, I used to see this super pixilated photo of Sushi Neko and it's location, right in front of Hwaro. Then, while on a search for a new GO-TO sushi spot, this came about!   I love the sushi to rice ratio when it comes to their nigiri. I always rave to my friends and people I don't even know that if you're going to have AYCE sushi, go to Sushi Neko. You get more than your money's worth, the food is fast, the waiters are nice, the fish to rice ratio is almost unbeatable, and everything is also instagram worthy.   I'll know if I'll like any sushi place by their salmon nigiri. Salmon nigiri is such a staple and basic, I believe it's equivalent to judging any boba shop by their milk tea. It's the standard. The salmon is so delicious! No only that, i usually don't order tuna nigiri, but this place offers "Garlic Tuna Nigiri" and it has made me fall in love with tuna!   You won't regret coming here, this place just keeps getting more and more popular!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sZJASGCSeSpjkKMVwsESIQ.text: We tried this place for the first time last night. We could tell it's popular as we waited about 30 minutes for our table. In the end, the wait was worth it!   Service was good! Our drinks came out quick & we weren't rushed to put in our food orders. We did the All You Can Eat so wanted to make sure we had our order ready to go.  We ordered, among other things, the red snapper, albacore 300, garlic tuna, topiko, lemon salmon roll, Mexican roll, bulgogi nachos & sashimi platter. These were all so good we ordered them multiple times! The highlight was undoubtedly the albacore 300! It came with a jalapeno & hot sauce on top.... Was delicious! Their topiko was amazing as well!   For dessert we had the tempura ice cream, honey toast & mochi... They were all good & we will definitely come back again VERY soon!

-01Nu6jOzQGnhIKfLG1RGQ.text: The best sushi we have ever had!  A coworker told me about this place because I was complaining the last nigiri we had was more rice than fish so she recommended Sushi Necko. We came for lunch and I wish we were coming back for dinner. Everything we had was delicious, and service was very friendly. Now there are no other sushi places for us!

qoP5sU6Gz9pTgvzTxIqjpQ.text: I love sushi Neko, they have the best nigiri portions in all of Las Vegas, it's the only place I go to.

aTb0znKlUH1rElXOTlVr5Q.text: Affordable and fresh sushi. Tucked away in the corner of a China Town Plaza, this sushi restaurant is one of the best in town. I've been coming for years and the sushi here is still as fresh as the first day that I came. I hope you enjoy the sushi here as much as I do.

jB6typAkLMRanQObLIRXjw.text: Yummy yummy!  This is a find! In china town and after finding his little gem, I almost do not want to share because sometimes the wait is extensive, however soooo worth the wait.  The service is excellent as there is always someone around to get you what you need.  We usually go in a group and I cannot do all you can eat as my appetite just can't do more then some nigiri and a roll, my friends always do the AYCE, very well priced and a great selection.  The fish always fresh and you can tell they get it in daily, with as busy as they are they must have to keep up with demand.  Also a great and fun place for a birthday celebration!  I like the

mNTt5U6A4QNETN9lgv5VgA.text: This place is okay if you know what you're getting into...  Pros: - Cheap all you can eat sushi. - Everything was good and came out fast. - The service was on point and speedy for lunch time.  Cons: - There is so. much. sauce on everything. Tells me the fish isn't fresh and they have to put a bunch of crap on it - even the nigiri. The only stuff that didn't have sauce were the cooked nigiri like shrimp.  - Definitely not authentic. At all.

2X0T_kmkNF1k9EnV3OGNQA.text: Solid ACYE sushi place!!!   I've been to other ACYE spots and they would give you a small place of fish on a large amount of rice. But I liked that they give you a decent piece of fish on a small amount of rice. It was nice cause we were apart of a huge group so they broke up us up into sections rather than trying to take order from the whole group. It made ordering a lot easier.   There were certain items that they limited you to, I highly recommend that you order them. All of those items were so delicious! And they also have a few options that don't have rice. All of those options were good too. They also have other items other than sushi and rolls, like yakitori. We tried some of those items too and they were good.   I would have to say that some of their desserts were not good. The brick toast was very disappointing. It's basically just a Hawaiian roll that they put some honey on and toasted with an ice cream scoop on top. I would say any of the other desserts are better.

ZYzarnEztK8pjQ4O9MZAqA.text: Pros: food was delicious!!! I will give this place another try only because the sushi was fresh and tasted amazing   Cons: we ended up leaving without half of our food because we never got it and it was like pulling teeth to get someone to take an order.   I will give it another try and hopefully be able to go up to 5 stars... a little service goes a long way.  Update!!!  Service was 100% time better. We were greater promptly, &!checked on often. We did have to ask for the beer we ordered a few times but with that mind of food quality and a friendly smile here and there I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0rNXMKGK_ul85WNLroBDUA.text: With the recommendation from a friend, I decided to have a girls' lunch here the other day. So the cool thing is that these are the same owners as the location on Maryland! The interior is super cute, artsy and hipster! While all that is good - the food is simply basic...A-OK!  The spicy garlic edamame had a super spicy sauce on top, which wasn't good, it was too spicy with an uncomfortable after taste. We couldn't even finish these.  The green mussels were probably the only thing good here. Juicy, cheesy and very flavorful! I would totally recommend these and order them again.  The KFC, Korean fried chicken was okay. The crispy exterior with a juicy interior these chickens were good.   The baked lobster roll was interesting, while everything g looked good, the weird fishy after taste did not leave a good taste in my mouth. Pass.   I enjoyed the orange salmon, which consisted of sashimi, lemon wedge, and fresh ingredients.   The service was mediocre. At times we waited for someone to take our order and other times we felt rushed when they were finally assisting us. It was a weird vibe.   Would I return?? Probably not. There are other places that offer AYCE... here the cost is $20.99 for AYCE..

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h9NJyMHgIczB8qDl5DajIg.text: Gotta say, after almost 10 years of being loyal to one particular AYCE sushi hole in the wall joint, Sushi Neko has been the first to tempt us from straying away from the path despite trying out dozens of sushi places.  Sushi Neko is kind of hidden in a typical china town plaza off of Spring Mnt road, but pretty spacious on the inside so wait time isn't too bad.    The menu:  extensive than the usual AYCE menu, but what caught our attention is the additional "off the wall" apps and dishes.  Make sure to ask the waitress for their recommendations and for their signature dishes... you won't be disappointed.    Finally, the wall art.  Being a long time "Slam Dunk" Shojo manga and anime fan, their wall art took me home to my younger nostalgic days of Sakuragi Hanamich and Sendoh basketball days.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hutVFg06MPTrum_ZmNM22A.text: This has got to be one of my favorite sushi places to go to. My girlfriend and I come here possibly 2 to 5 times a month. The sushi is as fresh as you can get it here in Las Vegas. Sushi Neko is also the sister restaurant to Sakana so if that's closer to you they are identical. We usually do the all you can eat and that usually runs us $26 dollars a person for dinner price. The lunch price is cheaper but we usually don't make it for lunch time. If you order sake or beer it'll be more expensive.   The restaurant decor is very casual laidback with music playing. If you're looking for an experience along with a dinner this isn't quite it. They walk up ask if you're ready and they start taking your order. The servers check up on you often and are kind but they move quick so they don't ask too many questions. You don't really get a name or a welcome. It's a fast turnover restaurant so conversing slows the servers down. If you're looking for great quality food bottom line then this is for you! It's lit bright inside and the service is so quick. Seriously a must try if you love seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly, sea urchin, sweet shrimp, squid and salmon.
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quail Egg and Surf Clam.
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Urchin.

u6HADDOLhJ9387p_ItdJgg.text: In land of Vegas AYCE places, this sushi restaurant stands out.  The large variety of choices for appetizers, sushi and rolls are almost overwhelming.  Located in a busy mall, it's hard to find and not clearly visible from street.  Have been here multiple times and still could not try everything on the menu.  Being AYCE, they will ask that you eat all that you order including the rice. Among the standouts were yellowtail neck grilled, most of the sushi pieces, grilled skewers (garlic, mushroom were better) and desert (ice cream).  Didn't get the rolls, it's not our thing. Lunch or dinner prices were reasonable, and if you are drinking then prices will go up depending on how much you drink.  Some of what we found to be good about sushi Neko were:  -fresh ingredients, we didn't find anything stale -high quality, even rice that they use is of good quality -interesting food ideas, inventive items abound in the menu -good service, owner and staff keep busy ordering and clearing tables -attractive interior and clean layout  We'll be back.

D3mQke-X381ANUk6gee4qQ.text: This is probably one of the better ayce places for sushi in Las Vegas. If you like Sakana, then you will like this. It is owned by the same people. In fact, everything is identical to Sakana. The menu and rolls are the same.   There are plenty of parking. The outside parking can get packed but you can utilize the parking garage. It is also bigger than Sakana so there are plenty of seats and better for large groups. Wait times can be a bit long depending what time you come. We came with a group of 4 and waited about 30 mins.   Everything is delicious here. Rolls can me ordered in half, that way u can try a bit of everything. The rice to fish ratio for nigiri is superb. The slices of fish they give u are huge.   We always get yellowtail Hamachi. It's so good! However, they did limit us on how much we can order. We never had that issue at Sakana. Always go for the dinner only (1 per person) such as oysters, uni, salmon belly, etc.   Overall, I would come here again. Service was great. You also get a free drink wither soda or Hite beer of you check in through yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZFNi49WtBg52ILTNFUG3hw.text: My first time here I it definitely won't be my last! From the time we walked in the door to getting seated right away (on a Saturday night) to getting stuffed off all the sushi, this place is legit. It was a busy Saturday night, when me and my boyfriend walked in I was prepared to sign my name on the clipboard for the waiting list as I see a couple parties waiting to get seated. But one of the workers immediately sat us down at the table before I was able to sign my name, so awesome!  The interior design is super cute, you almost forget you're in Vegas. We had multiple servers, which was great because we knew we weren't being forgotten about among all the huge parties inside.   The fish here is really fresh and you can really tell the difference from other AYCE sushi places in town. The fish to rice ratio is 2:1 since the fish is literally double the size of the rice. The rice is also really fresh and was always warm so I knew it was fresh and not left in the fridge overnight. Everything we ordered tasted amazinggggg. My favorites are the nigiri pieces, the fish was fresh and left me wanting more.   The service here was excellent, our waters were always being refilled and tables cleared of empty plates. Yes I recommend this place for AYCE sushi && yes I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamagoo
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iXdamQyvZ21BXEExhHZ6iQ.text: Sushi Neko  I heard many good things about this AYCE sushi restaurant.  Sushi Neko is located in the heart of Chinatown.  But, I had high expectations and it did really exceed those expectations. I believe the amount of food you order and the quality of what you are getting at Sushi Neko is worth it. .. First, the ambiance of the restaurant was quite nice, and the decor is very artistic and creative. Also, you can hear KPOP music playing in the background with their huge screens around the restaurant.  Second, the service is perfect! The server was generous. He came by the table to check on us; from making sure if we wanted more food to pouring our empty water cups.  Lastly, I wasn't really into eating the fried sushi/rolls, but the fish quality was fresh and delicious. I liked [preference] they didn't not put much rice with the [nigiri sushi] fish. But, I will definitely come back again! This is the perfect to-go sushi place in Vegas that I would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V31uQQAoSEAZwlWHMtQmig.text: Sushi Neko definitely provides a solid and high quality All You Can Eat sushi experience!    This is a relatively tiny spot within a plaza of at least  20 other restaurants and offerings right smack dab in the middle of Asia town. I only took a photo of a few of my favorite rolls ... But one can definitely get the idea of what to expect on your next trip to this awesome place. Upon initial arrival, there was the 25 minute wait....But I was assured by the person that recommended the spot that it's definitely worth it.We arrived at 8:00 p.m.  friday .   Once seated, we received impeccable service and prompt food delivery. They allow half rolls. You may order more than one dessert.    A couple of times we received food that we had not ordered. But it was quickly rectified each time.  Sushi Neko is a must try for visitors and natives alike !    Prices:5/5 Service:5/5 Ambience: 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sapporo to begin!
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand rolls are a must try
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy busy !

X-TFaSKbuPj_uy9WjaXu0w.text: Wow!  Went to Vegas on a recent trip and had all you can eat sushi at this restaurant.  Incredibly good and had such a huge selection. Almost 80 different items you can choose from. I was really impressed with the appetizers and the selection of desserts.   The sushi was really delicious and not a lot of rice.  Nigiri was cut beautifully and tasty!  I loved the Korean affogato as an apres meal dessert.  We went at lunch time and the line was not bad, but if you go in the evening, it will be a long wait since this is a popular sushi spot in Vegas and for good reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool artwork.
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful nigiri

bHpuK6_xkQ-hu0OPoHLPMg.text: It took about 15-20 minutes to have the server bring us water. After that they were speedy in getting our order.   One thing that I have to say is that the server seemed irritated when taking our order. Maybe it was because it was busy, but that kind of discouraged us to order. She took our order twice in the time that we were there.   Keep in mind that some of the rolls are pre-made (per our server) and if you have an allergy they will not make you another one; you'll have to order something that doesn't contain what you are allergic too.   We would probably come back, just because the food is great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our daughter loves Edamame!

7Bf0zz91CYtIRB3k6Chsjw.text: Full five for this place and I don't usually like Sushi joints where I can't sit at a bar. This place is an experience. The ambiance is cool, the service is friendly and helpful, the menu is vast and the food is fresh and delicious. I have already been back for a business lunch with a vendor who flew in from NY to meet me and she loved it. My 16 year old daughter would eat here twice a week if I would take her. The only problem I have is that there's so much going on here, I have yet to truly absorb the menu  and try everything I want to. Not to worry though, I'm committed to doing that...

__6e6sa1493qCbJTte0vzw.text: This place is so good! I came in during lunch with my bf for AYCE lunch and the service was amazing. Everything we ordered came out so fast. We ordered a lot of the no rice rolls and plenty of appetizers. My favorite was the sashimi roll and the sushi tower. I love all the skewers you can get and Ofcourse we had to have 5 orders of the baked mussels. We ate so much and everything was tasty and service was friendly! I will continue to return to this sushi place over and over. We had to finish with the AFFOGATO! So yummy,espresso,ice cream and topped with Frosted Flakes. The inside of this restaurant is very colorful and pretty you will definitely love eating here.

yldw0XfRJpL0t6kE_gp5Nw.text: BS ++  A nice find in the heart of Chinatown.  I would never have even went inside unless I stopped and started looking around.  The outside looks deceptive.  I would give it a chance once you come in.  First of, it's a buffet.  Choose wisely because the food comes in generous sizes not very small at all.  Don't over order unless you have been lost in the desert and failed at doing some Man VS Wild survivalist tricks.  This place will fulfill all your sushi dreams with their huge menu.  The price is very cheap as well considering all your options.  Only some stuff do not come with AYCE but everything else is fair game.  I would consider doing apps first and then work your way into the rolls.  There are so much to choose from and unless you are really hangry and have no respect for your stomach ORDER THEM ALL.  I love the menu and it truly breaks it down for you.  This place will also blow you away with their JPOP/KPOP decor.  The place has beautiful waitresses who will cater to you and explain everything.  I suggest giving it a try and get to bop your head to some B2K.  The parking lot is not bad during weekday but be warned this place fills up very quicky.  So come one - come all!  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

rjJZTtQRXDmAQVnLYST0lw.text: After hearing this was the best sushi spot in Vegas we decided to give it a try.  Sushi Neko is located in Chinatown in a strip mall, like most places in Chinatown. It is tucked away in the first floor in the corner.  There are all you can eat lunch and dinner options. Both include appetizers, sushi rolls, sashimi, and dessert. They do sell sake but it is an additional charge.  The sushi was amazing, like melt in your mouth amazing. I do have to say this is the best sushi I've had to date in Las Vegas.  The staff was friendly and came by often to check on us.

TtwA_eHXeF_yqBMJdotY0A.text: Sushi Neko and I have this strong relationship...Hands down, my favorite sushi spot in the city!! I celebrated my 21st birthday here and the workers get LIT & sing a song for the birthday celebrant. It's their own lil' thang and it's cute!    This place is fitting for a party (group of 18), but cannot reserve on the weekends. They can accomendate all your needs for the perfect sushi experience. Also, it's great for a group of friends or dates if you want to eat good for the night. Anything you want or need, Sushi Neko will provide!!  I love the sushi here. I've been eating sushi all my life.   I always recommend the Chanel roll, unagi, and smoke paprika salmon.

Ht2KK2WWOWcVeGELtyf-cA.text: Best Sushi Ever. Rolls are huge!!! Excellent staff. Food presentation is superb. Flavor is fantastic!! Unusual names for their rolls. Well priced and friendly.  Will become a regular spot for me when I'm in Vegas.

WuYSYsoCNelL8CZPTZIfdg.text: If you love your fish (I cant imagine you don't if you're reading a sushi restaurant review) Sushi Neko is THE place for AYCE. The fish to rice  ratio is unheard of for AYCE and the price is comparable. The fishb portion is more apparent in nigiri. My personal fave is the super white tuna. Great selection of appetizers too. My only complaint is that the food servers sometimes don't get all of your order out if you ordered a good number of items at one time and we've had a dish or 2 placed on our table that wasn't outs. Still, easy to overlook because the food is just so good.

Vv_d0fyS4WL03R7wNX2j7Q.text: I went to a Sushi Neko for the second time today:  A hostess whose name tag read "Panda" seated us.   Immediately, the two small soy sauce dipping plates were very dirty. As soon as our waitress came by (a young girl with long red hair), to take our order, we asked for clean ones. She apologetically took them and came back with new ones, and we placed our order (California Roll, Yellowtail nigiri, Lobster Baked Roll, and Salmon Lover Roll). I also ordered two waters.  We got our Cali Roll right away. No waters. Gradually, we got the rest of our order. Good timing. One of them was spicy, so we had to order our waters from a male busser. He said, "Oh, you didn't get your waters?" We said no and he came back with two waters.   We already had about six rolls left of our order at this point. As I was sipping my water, I noticed black marks on the cup and tried to scratch them out from the outside. They didn't come off. I took my straw and scratched the inside of it. Sure enough, the stains were inside the cup.   That was definitely strike three, so I immediately approached the hostess and asked for a manager. She told me there wasn't one available, so I asked for a supervisor, or anyone in charge. She attempted to dissolve the situation, but at this point, I was adamant about letting "upper" management know.   A chef by the name of Sai (?) came out to speak to me and I let him know of everything I was not happy with. He definitely hesitated, but I wasn't looking for anything but to be validated. I just told him it was not okay and he agreed. I also let him know that I did not mind paying for what I had already ate (keeping in mind that the dirty cups came WAY after the order was placed). He finally offered to cover half the bill and I was okay with that. I thanked him. As I was walking out, the entire staff said sorry and I just thanked them.  I hope they get to this because we know how hard it is to work for tips or how much products cost. So if it's of any importance to them, they will try to improve it for their other customers because I will not be going back.  The food seems of good quality (4/5) The service is too unorganized (2/5) Atmosphere is okay (3.5/5) Cleanliness needs major improvement (2/5)

u5qT6vzhxbov6FGppnPbJg.text: I came here to eat almost four years, really like nigiri here,really fresh! The service always good. However! This is my first time met this rude server! We order by the number, the server told us had to say the name of order. She just helped us to take only one order, and did not ask us anymore. Well, we will come again, but I don't want serve by her anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We order by the number, the server told us had to say the name of order. She just helped us to take only one order. How rude!
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I came here to eat almost four years, really like nigiri here,really fresh! The service always good.

B-xY_SWmT9fICTFk4DS4jQ.text: This moved into the top AYCE for me in Las Vegas. The only knock was the service was slow so make sure you load up on your order because they come by your table every 15 mins or so. The miso soup was the best I've had anywhere and the fish on the nigiri pieces was very generous as everyone describes in other reviews. One piece of advice is to make sure and order 1/2 rolls on the 8 piece styles.  The rolls are large and very filling, but we didn't think to ask until afterwards if they did 1/2 rolls. The last thought is that the music is loud and annoying as they play weird Asian pop videos, but will definitely be heading back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Affogato Dessert

gXjA-imPTtGRvToj-2xvMQ.text: We've come here multiple times and it has always satisfied.  But once in awhile the nigiri can be drenched in sauce that you can't taste the fish. But they got an extensive menu for ayce; apps, nigiri, specialty rolls. One of the better sushi options in town.

QdfuT2ReKHtNKlpDu535jw.text: This is a pretty good place to get sushi if you are in the Chinatown area! It is located in the corner of the plaza right across the street from where Kung Tea is at.  For about $26, you can eat all the sushi you can fit into your stomach for dinner! The fish to rice ratio is really good and pretty much every fish I had was good (none of that super fishy taste except for things like mackerel which I don't know how people could eat that). I recommend trying the gyoza, lemon salmon, orange blossom, Chanel, and lobster roll. The waitress recommended trying "The Shit" which is one of the 2 highly recommended items, but I personally did not like it. I'm not sure what taste they were going for, but I can only remember a fried outer shell with mushy imitation crab (?) on the inside. The dipping sauce did make it taste a bit better, but I'm still not convinced as to why it is highly recommended. They also have a bunch of one time order only items like salmon belly, so needless to say, order those for sure! The skewers were really good to. I got the sausage one and the bacon and scallop (highly recommended and a nice break from just eating sushi).  Note: Dessert is also included on the menu! You can pick one ice cream flavor in addition to one of their other items (i.e. mini honey brick toast, mochi, tempura ice cream, etc.)  Overall, if you are looking for a good sushi place, definitely check this place out. They also play lots of Korean music videos if that is what you're into as well xD. The cat design is pretty neat so cat lovers be sure to go here! I'd recommend going here on a Friday or Saturday night because it has such a lively atmosphere and it gives you something fun to do! Only thing is there might be a wait. I went with a friend around 7:30 on a Friday night and we just had to wait about 15-20 min.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri!
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agedashi tofu and pang
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad! Really good

6tIED7aYRFYekTzaZRs1bg.text: This may be my new favorite place to go. Sushi is fresh, service is great and lots of options.  Like most of the other reviews... I definitely think they're good with sushi to rice ratio. It's also nice that they have half roll options. There were so many rolls I liked that I couldn't say there really was a bad one. And the nigiri was on point, too.  It's pretty good for groups.  I visited twice and both times there were several large groups.  My only gripes: they don't have a set waiter it seems and we kept getting asked for drinks and food when someone had just come around. And then by the end there was no one who was coming around. And then also the issue with the regulation of ordering. I guess though, when you order a lot

GMEueBs-r4S01tVL0uT1lA.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi place, or at least it used to be. The sushi tastes very fresh every single time I come and the desserts are amazing (mini honey toast is my fav.) I'm giving them 3 stars because almost every time I come here they forget half of my order, which results in my table having to re order and even then we don't get everything. Also the customer service is semi okay dependent upon who you get. Some are super sweet, the others are pushy and kinda snappy.

Q2A1999QH0UweMDh-WAGrg.text: My recent visit to Sushi Neko was actually my first time ever, and I think it's safe to say that I've found a new go to sushi place!! My entire experience was very enjoyable. The ambiance is very relaxed and hip, with cool murals on the walls and this really unique wooden tree installation.  The service was so speedy and polite, and the servers stopped by often to make sure we were doing okay!   Now as for the food...all the dishes I ordered were amazing!! The fish to rice ratio was very generous with the fish and it was very fresh tasting. Though I only ordered a few rolls, the menu had a lot of variety, and everything that I ordered was exceptionally flavorful and saucy!   I'm already missing Sushi Neko, and I'll definitely come back here for my next sushi fix!!

E-5jBu_1FjbawXkrz8Fxfw.text: This was my first time here and EVERYTHING was perfect.  I had the KFC, The Shit, The Jack Pot Roll and the Popcorn Lobster Roll...delicious.  The sushi was fresh and the service was exceptional.  This will be my go to place for sushi.

71_VG9ucn22vFD_-d4QatA.text: This might be my a favorite AYCE sushi spot in Las Vegas. The nigiri come with way more fish than rice and it is amazing. I highly recommend trying the KFC(Korean fried chicken). Only thing I didn't like was that they brought out our rolls first so by the time the nigiri came out we were pretty much full.

ld7q0oIikl9U180wHI1mlw.text: Coming from Hawaii where we only have one AYCE, we wanted to eat at one of the many AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas.  We read all the reviews on YELP and I made the choice, choosing Sushi Neko. BAD CHOICE!!!  The nigiri sushi was ok but everything else we ate was subpar. The hamachi collar was overcooked and oily, the yakitori sticks were very small with tiny shrimps or dried out sausages, the seafood salad were scraps of salmon throw on lettuce, the agedashi tofu was dry and small as your fingernail and their dessert of tiramisu was dry and tasteless.  And to top it off the men's restroom was filthy with overflowing trash and sticky urine floor, DISGUSTING!!!  Can't understand the 4 star rating.

j2xtSTy99fxzPY_Md6n5sw.text: First time coming with a few of Co-workers after a hike & I can honestly say it was alright. I had high expectations due to some reviews & word of mouth but it wasn't what I expected for the price of ACE. Once we got seated we had a waitress who was nice & tried her best, but when she came to ask for our drinks a few asked for water & assumed thats what everyone wanted & walked away. It probably took me 15-20 min just to be able to ask for a sprite. As she came to my section of the table to get the rest of our orders she walked away again & forgot to ask what the 2 others seated in front of us wanted. Order a few appetizers - got them right away- & order 3 signature rolls. I received 1 roll which was the "burning my Ass roll" (was really good & would come back just for that), but didn't receive my 2 other rolls for about 30 minutes (basically had to reorder) once I got it I didn't like it at all & I was full already so I had to force myself to eat it.   **My biggest problem though was with a certain waiter. He didn't know any of the names of the rolls so we had to attempt to figure out which rolls were what & who ordered them. I felt disrespected & felt a lack of common curtesy from him. We would all be eating & he'd be looking over our shoulders searching for empty dishes. I get it your trying to clear out our table but he wouldn't say anything & reach his arm right in between our faces mid eating & his armpit is literally 2 inches from my face. The funny thing was he wouldn't ask if we were done with empty dishes in the middle of our table but when we decided to put them at the end of the table to avoid armpit in our face he asked if we were finished with them???***   I'd would give them another chance..maybe there other stuff is really good. I'll just have to find out whenever I came back.

uIFySPtOcBONzpG9IK2GfQ.text: Tucked into a little dark corner in Chinatown is one of the best places for AYCE sushi in Las Vegas... Seriously.  I try to stay away from AYCE places because many of them a) make their rolls too small in order to make more money off of the customer, b) have less than ideal quality sushi sometimes, or c) cost too much for the minimal amount of time you are given for AYCE (i.e. some places it is 30 or less minutes).   HOWEVER, when I came to Sushi Neko with a colleague, I was pleasantly surprised! Their lunch portion of AYCE is almost $21.00 (which is AWESOME!), and dinner is about $25.00. For lunch you are given 60 minutes, and 80 minutes for dinner. If you order AYCE, the full menu is available to you (excluding 4-5 items which are for dinner customers only). I ate quite a bit of sushi in that time, and all of it was DELICIOUS!  My personal recommendations: The Butter Fly! It has peanut butter, but I swear it is amazing! The Popcorn Lobster The Honey! Screaming O! The Wet Dream Appetizer - "The Shit" - You seriously will not be disappointed if you like spicy crab The Baked Lobster The Philadelphia And pretty much anything else on the menu.  Here you can also order 1/2 rolls to try new things and not have to eat something you hate. The staff is helpful and friendly and the service is quick.  5 stars all around!!!

ObizpkD-cajAZV3y2Cojdg.text: Amazing service, fresh fish, unique rolls, great music, and the list goes on. Hands down my new favorite all you can eat sushi spot in Las Vegas. Can't wait to go back!

LHlZ10unxClxh7MLFPEKEg.text: Fish is decent at best, some of the fish we ate just had the rubbery/chewy texture. Service kind of left us in the dark, mixed up orders, and they forgot a lot of we ordered. To top our disappointment, we found plastic in one of your desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plastic in the dessert.

7INcprVStgXKW3ceYkytuA.text: Hands down best sushi in town. A lot of people including myself don't have high expections for the fish quality when choosing all you can eat, but this restaurant is completely different. I've been to Sushi Neko for years and their food has been always fresh and good. Their fish to rice ratio is just unbelievable...!! They take reservations so if you have a party of 20+, I would call a week or two before and save spot. If anyone is looking for a sushi restaurant with all you can eat in Vegas, this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O_QgT_qX7GN_loz_yD2UTQ.text: Went in for all you can eat. Service was very fast. The udon and the miso soup were kind of bland. They have quite the selection of rolls to try. Will definitely keep sushi neko in my options for all you can eat still.

6p2Wc5HmKeKtOYmHic97DQ.text: This place has great food it was delicious , location good , ambience great. The only reason a 4 star and not 5 star is because they are very unorganized. 3 different waiters came up to us 5 or 6 different times asking us if we ordered a certain item on the menu . It was kind of distracting while trying to have a conversation but I will say our food and drinks came very fast. I will be back.

RKcYLDntKsXGgOztH8AmcA.text: I've found my new favorite all you can eat sushi spot. The quality is much better than most and rolls are all well crafted. The sashimi roll, wrapped in cucumber, was a good mix of flavors with generous cuts of tuna, salmon, white fish, and crab. Both the Hawaiian roll and red dragon rolls were good as well with ample fresh ingredients and minimal rice.  Nigiri is good too. The cuts of fish are large and the rice is well seasoned. Their menu has plenty of small bites available like pork belly -- two thing slices of fatty and meaty pork. I loved the subtle sweetness of the sauce.  Desserts were decent. They have mini versions of honey toast using Hawaiian roles toasted, covered in honey and topped with vanilla ice cream. With the tempura ice cream, I thought the dough was too thick and slightly undercooked.  The service was great and the interior is beautiful, modern and kitschy with anime and super hero items found throughout. The most impressive element is the large wooden tree towards the back of the dining room.  4.5 Stars

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian roll ($10.95) - spicy tuna, cucumber inside, tuna, avocado with spicy garlic ponzu outside
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red dragon roll ($10.95) - spicy tuna, cucumber inside, eel with spicy eel sauce outside

uAM2B6r5exK9rbvH0tA0KQ.text: I went there with my date several times and each time was just perfect . We got AYCE dinner for about 26$ each ( the total was about 57$ after tax) . The stuff is really friendly . The fish that they serve is fresh and the amount of fish that they give you is very generous . My salmon sushi was so heavy that I could barely lift it with my chopsticks . They also serve extremely fast . The order comes in 3-4 minutes .  So far , this is my favorite place to go for sushi !

owetgydU3QFtpTim-gF7lQ.text: 1. Ac is nice and cold 2. Nice servers and super fast 3. You should get the ayce option 4. Fish tasted super fresh 5. Great option when you want to eat sushi without the Vegas strip price 6. Will come again when here

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rJLFZkxK8YNnNHIg85Ctdw.text: Sushi Neko always has fresh Sushi.   They have a wonderful a variety of rolls and are always pleasant.

5YRT0Aacyt1F0e8PAgscWg.text: My experience in going to sushi neko was not bad at all. This was the original spot of Shuseki which was my favorite place. After reading multiple reviews saying this place is Sakana's sister company. They were right saying the rice ratio was pretty minimal. Each layer of nigiri fish was long on each sushi.  My favorite nigiri is the "Salmon Paprika Nigiri" out of all the sushi I had from this place. Will definetly come back to this place, just maybe once in awhile. Will recommend to my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun tuna &amp; salmon paprika.
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic edamame.
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu yellowtail.

HOOB6mgH8DWWCSnGGW-YQA.text: Favorite AYCE sushi place is Vegas, hands down.  A few co-workers and I had tried this place when they first opened (probably in 2016) and we loved it! I don't know why, but I had fallen off and hadn't eaten here in a while.  Last month my boyfriend was craving sushi so we came in, and we've been back at least once a week since! The fish to rice portions on the nigiri are absolutely ridiculous (in the best way possible). The fish tastes soooo fresh. My favorites are lemon salmon, white tuna, and the albacore! My boyfriend only gets rolls and his favorites are the Lobster King and the Popcorn Lobster.   The variety of desserts are what really makes them unique! The mini honey toast is the perfect size and tastes great. I've also tried the green tea ice cream, tiramisu, mochi, affogato, and the birthday cake! :) All were great.   Servers are friendly and check on you often. Food also comes out insanely fast. Would definitely recommend.

9Zm5CH9437M8KJzgY9FMOQ.text: Love this place. If you go - you need to get the "All You Can Eat." This includes: apps, sushi rolls, desserts AND sake! You cannot go wrong. Service is great. Place is super cute and trendy for IG pics. I knock off one star because I wish they took reservations. Most definitely one of my favorite sushi spots to go to. I take all of my family and friends here who love Sushi.

FsF--BfNozji-jQRm90LpQ.text: What is not to love about this place? We came here for lunch, and ordered a bunch of sushi for the buffet. For an AYCE place, the quality is exceptional. The fish was fresh, and everything came out really great. You also get a very large menu to pick from, anything from appetizers to nigiris and hand rolls. All good. It's also super kids friendly with tons of space to run around... I'd say, this was the best find on our last trip to Vegas!

nOedynbOPs8OFWLoUHz4aA.text: Definitely one of the better AYCE sushi joints in town.  My coworker and I came for lunch one day to try this place out to since I'm such a sushi addict. We were seated right away and it's nice that the table are of rather large or size so we could fit all the food that I was about to consume. Oink oink. We ordered a bunch of stuff right away including my favorite white tuna, uni and sweet shrimp. We also ordered a bunch of different worries including the salmon, tuna, albacore, yellowtail. The fish to rice ratio is pretty good.  The service was also very nice, our drinks were filled without asking. The restaurant is kind of small and intimate, which is better than a lot of the larger more warehouselike feel sushi joints in town. They also had some nice dessert options that we really enjoyed.  The restaurant is very clean, the bathrooms are clean, service was very nice, and I definitely recommend this place! We will be coming back soon.

Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M83_j29fZXCLAn767CYadw.text: " The Best Sushi Restaurant in Las Vegas" quote My self   Got the recommendation from a close friend and wow. Pulled up and thought , not sure, not to amazing from the out side, as soon as you walk in slap to the face it's awesome. Full of neat art work , cool music, and nice people.  We were seated right away , our waitress went over the menu and suggested a few things. The wife and I did all you can eat ( very affordable $25 a person ). I started with a few of the suggestions and some nigiri.  The nigiri,  each pice was perfect,  great size , great taste and quick( literally about 3 min and my full plate of nigiri was at the table) . All the types of fish I ordered were delicious. The tuna quality was top notch amazing texture and taste.   THE ROLLS, incredible the wife ordered them and I have no idea what the names were but they were all amazing , they offered 1/2 orders so we could try different combinations, and they were all pretty amazing.   So all in all this place kicks ass , it will be my new spot. I now feel I need to reevaluate some older reviews at different places cause no where is this good!!   Can't wait to go back !!!!!!!!

KQmKHUJdGrgclQg84ZsE6g.text: Great decor and atmosphere. Receptionist was very responsive even when the line was out the door. Prices are very comparable to other AYCE places. Sodas are not refillable probably because they come out in soda cans. Went for a birthday hoping to get them to dim the lights play the birthday song and sing along, was told it had to be the actual birthday even though it was 2 days later no biggie understandable a lot of people want things for free. Any how everything was fresh and served fast. There was no rush for you to eat and leave. I would recommend this place. 4 stars due to no refills on sodas

l3AwOz2udbMWMht6zp0Z1Q.text: I'm not sure how this place is still open. It is beyond dirty. I found little bugs in my food. There were large chunks of dirt build up falling off the fans onto people and their food. I would not recommend this place.

WhDBKNP5cQaLUn7jQMPKIw.text: Having been here more times than I can count, I can say this place is great! They have one of the largest menus I've seen at a sushi restaurant.  There are so many rolls to choose from there is something for everyone. The nigiri is amazing because the amount of fish to rice you get can't be beat. The service is usually great and to top it all off is the AYCE price making it all worth it with out breaking the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted nigiri and uni.

AM31UChUjic581v24q1pmw.text: What a great new find.  I loved that they offer riceless rolls!  The sashimi roll was wrapped in cucumber and was so refreshing and delicious!  The sashimi that they have has very large cuts of fish.  I wasn't too big of a fan of the spicy garlic edamame, they had a bit too much sauce on it however everything else was great!  The bathrooms were well kept, the servers seemed to all be working together as a team, and my water glass was never left empty!  The ambiance is neat as well.  The only negative was that at the end we asked to split the check three ways and the girl said they couldn't do that.  I explained to her how to do it and of course they were able to.  Besides that, everything was amazing and we left with full bellys!  I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi roll - delicious
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly

BF9VR6TpxQRhDuxYnSCNRw.text: Saw a poster of Sushi Neko outside of Hwaro. Since Hwaro is my go-to KBBQ, I figured I could give Sushi Neko a shot since they are owned by the same management company! Sushi Neko is located in the Chinatown Plaza that is directly across the KFT/Curry Zen Plaza. It's a bit hidden so park in the back, and you'll see the sushi house as you drive by.  We walked in just to see that it is completely empty. We were a tad bit hesitant since it was weird to find a restaurant empty for lunch but we gave it a chance anyway. Overall, their menu is very similar to Sakana's but once the rolls came out, we learned that they make it differently. So if you enjoy the types of rolls at Sakana, you can try this place for a different twist of your favorites.   Their fish to rice ratio is pretty good! They have a wide range of options for rolls and appetizers. The only thing about Sushi Neko was that they overload their rolls with sauce. If you enjoy that, then this is the place for you. But personally, I prefer to have light sauce because I like to taste the fish!   Overall, it was OKAY. As most AYCE sushi places in Vegas are typically crowded with long wait lines, I would suggest coming by for a quick sushi fix.  PRO TIP: ORDER PAPRIKA SALMON AND OCEAN TROUT!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu! So cute!
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor! Pictures of cats...get it?!?
Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hulk burrito

HmP0qfPuQ3zHypkfJlxdsg.text: I found my new favorite place! This is the best sushi I've had to date by my criteria. The salmon was so fresh and beautiful. When those huge beautiful pieces of nigiri landed in front of me, my friend and I could only reply with "wow". The fish to rice ratio is the best I've found probably ever! It was so amazing. I can't rave enough about it. It was easily two to one at least. The squid was great. They have half rolls so you can try everything. The surf clam and octopus are among the best I've had! The atmosphere is fantastic. I'm definitely bringing more people here. The service was great. The chef were pros putting out our order at lightening speeds. I'm in love with this place.  Update: Make sure to try "The Shit" and say hi to the great service provided by Elaine and Edison.

TspxsX0PL4KTBrLVpPc5vw.text: quality is ok to subpar... it's not super fresh and the quality is subpar... I believe the crab is more imitation crab... if you are into rolls then this place is for you, if you want fresh sushi--- go somewhere else

veTi5OqkF2DTRfIKj5dgfg.text: First time coming here and I think I found my new favorite sushi spot. Service is great and the food is so amazing! My favorite was the salmon and yellow tail nigiri. The baked mussels was the best I've ever had! It's a cute place. Highly recommend!

6OMFIEtNH1jrrklk5nPIKw.text: Vest ayce in vegas, I love their lobster roll and hot sake. The salmon belly and super white tuna is freaking awesome

VNPiF98WuhtpyukU13_NCQ.text: came to neko with my party of 11 family for ayce. the service was good. although the server could smile a bit more. yes i know it's equally rude to request people to smile but it is a customer based industry. who knows. maybe she was having a bad day but the service was still delivered in a professional way regardless  now the food. this place probably has the freshest UNI and salmon in town! the uni taste as breezy as the ocean and the marbling on the salmon could be mistaken for the elegant floors you pave in your estate.   i only minus one star for the lighting. the yellow light and the fan directly over our table creates a strobing effect that brings nausea and migraine. i ask the employee to turn off the fan and he kindly did it without hesitation. i only want to point out the fact that this could bring health complications to people who are sensitive to light (epilepsy).   i don't have epilepsy but it was definitely causing me migraine and ruining my appetite seeing that water cup shadow flickering on and off, on and off. otherwise i give this place 5 stars.   i hope management will take my thoughts about the lighting into consideration for their future guest and hopefully this will help them avoid a medical disaster and a possible law suit.

vGS8aUHVippClIMfyHqTBQ.text: This is a good all you can eat sushi place. The servers are generally friendly. They have good rolls and nigiri. I personally love their oysters. They have good mochi for desert. They have a lot of seating and are good for reservations if you want to have a big group of people.

B67HtmrTguxpFRTz3_fIHA.text: Coming to Vegas, we use go to Sushi House Goyemon for our sushi binge eating experience. Well, move over Goyemon, Sushi Neko will be our new sushi binge eating go to spot. It's located in the SF Supermarket plaza in Chinatown just past Decatur on Spring Mountain Road.  The restaurant had tons of seating and no wait time, which is another big plus over Goyemon. The sushi here was also top notch - the rice to fish ratio was very favorable. For dinner, you can order special items like uni and salmon toro nigiri. They had a nice selection of rolls - stand outs include Salmon Holic, What the heck Roll, and the 300 hand roll. Service was really quick too. I'd highly recommend Sushi Neko if you are in the mood for a high quality sushi buffet.

6W9L0w_VVWHxDHQsJYTaaQ.text: Been here several times and plan on going back.  Food is fresh and delicious.  One of my go to sushi places.  Service is fast!

hU0Qtf4psasaaKEzBc63HQ.text: This place is amazing! Rice to fish ratio is unmatched, I'll be coming back here soon

U_5uB7bB0Dko-RWoCDoadQ.text: The hunt for  sushi continues...  Saw the reviews for this place. Thought we would check it out. Kinda hidden in the corner of the strip mall on spring mountain.   wasn't busy when we got there. decor was something different. restaurant is clean.   When it came to the food, was very disappointed by the quality and size.   for starters, we ordered ikura (circumference) was the size of a quarter and poorly presented. ordered saba (the waitress didn't know what i was talking about) so i told her it's mackerel. when that came, it was falling apart like it has been cooked well done. taste was griddy. also ordered the garlic tuna, the quality of the fish was tough. not sure if they cut it at the wrong angle but that was the first time i've ate it that tough. also had to keep reminding when i ordered before it even came out. probably waited a good 15 minutes and it was not busy at the time we were there.   my wife ordered her regular rolls. but she also gyoza which was never brought out.   in all honesty, probably won't be coming back here and will not be recommending this restaurant to any family/friends.

6OBNWpnPR87iBdca4ZtODA.text: This has quickly became a favorite spot for me! Decor is cute, and food is even better. They even let you order half rolls at tables!!!  There is no yellowtail sashimi, but they did have albacore that was very tasty. I've never had a seafood salad before, but I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed it. There's a spicy "amigo" roll that is a must try!!!  I can't wait to go back!

gp3n8amgCw_o3q4BvlYX9A.text: I have been a long-time customer and have eaten with Neko for years since the opening of their sister restaurant, Sakana. I've brought many family and friends here for AYCE sushi fix since the food is good. Lately, I have noticed that the service has gone downhill. I'm not sure if it's a change in management or what... Today I encountered a server named Hallie who was very stubborn. I was ordering dessert and normally the ice cream is unlimited and you get to choose one dessert from below (I have a picture as proof). Hallie was saying that if I got the ice cream I wouldn't be able to select an additional dessert.  The menu clearly states otherwise. Even if they decided to change their policy, they should update their menu to reflect those changes.  Next time, I will pick to come to Sushi Neko on a day where Joy is working because we always receive excellent service from her.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Neko - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qWVjoteIO7Trgqmkb7yvw.text: "Wow" was definitely the word that was uttered most of the night, along with the catchphrase, "service so fast you get whiplash!". It's beautiful inside, but that's more of the cherry on top to a fantastic restaurant like this. My party and I were seated on a busy Saturday night within 10 minutes, and the sushi was amazing! As other reviews have stated, the nigiri had a fish to rice ratio of 2:1 which is SO rare to see, with fish that had quality taste. We were extremely hungry so we'd quickly clean a plate and perhaps it was coincidence but the staff would immediately remove our plate the moment we took the last piece of sushi off, and it would happen every time! When we ordered dessert, it had felt like we just put the order in and turned our heads away before they came back with our ice creams and cute mini honey toasts. So basically what you need to know is: great food, great service, typical AYCE price, nice ambiance!

adDi_161FQZ5OHps5yntlg.text: Best sushi place in town ! 26$ all you can eat !!!! Been coming to this spot for two years now and they never disappoint! The honey and green tea desert is my fav ! The mussels and white tuna is bomb too! Pictures of the sushi on here is exactly what you get.

twi5KRSNJDxseTRS-LTqIQ.text: Other pros: short wait times, large can (or it bottle?) Japanese beer available, memorable decor (compared to other AYCE sushi joints) //// My rating system for value: 5-Stars = Great, 4-Stars = Good, 3-Stars = Ok, 2-Stars = Overpriced for what I'm getting, 1-Star = I feel cheated :/ ////////////////////// My Top 9 West-Side Value Eats (great food + great price). - As of 21 Sep 2018.  No particular order.  Bonus brownie points to places close to me, mom & pop shops, minimal wait times to get seated. a) KoMex - Korean-Mexican b) Sin Citys Taco China (near DI & Decatur) - Mexican c) Big Wong (near DI & Decatur) - Chinese d) Flock & Fowl or anything by Chef Sheridan's family (eg Fat Choy) e) Sushi Neko - AYCE sushi and fish portions are huge f) Jackson's Bar & Grill - about $15 for 16 oz ribeye meal available 24/7 g) Chuchote - Thai h) Estiatorio Milos (Strip) - Mediterranean, $29 three-course lunch i) Echo & Rig, best happy hour - $2 steak & egg from the restaurant's butcher shop

8bAqbf7zg-cIQEFW-mXYgg.text: I've been to Sushi Neko before and I had an enjoyable time, but this previous time was less than desirable. I don't know if there was a change in management or what, but the food wasn't good. The fish to rice ratio was terrible! I couldn't believe they had such big cuts of fish with a tiny amount of rice. Also, they forgot to bring out some of the things we ordered which I'm used to. The servers were also rude to us. Bad service isn't that big of a deal to me normally but the food wasn't good either so it was overall not a good experience. How are you going to play a Jiro Ono documentary but have your own sushi so lackluster :/  Update: all three of us who ate there got sick afterwards

HSzfhPrcKiAbXorXRPNBVA.text: We love Sushi Neko! We go here frequently for the lunch all you can eat sushi because you really can't beat $21 a person! However, we can't give it 5 stars because lately we have had to ask for rolls several times before they come out because the order doesn't get put in or they get "lost somewhere". Our favorites are the Golden Tiger roll, the lemon salmon, the monster roll and the kiss of fire (if you like a little spice!)

49-8eCEZfLOef1NNmuo6qQ.text: Fast friendly service Reasonable price ($25.95 AYCE dinner) Delicious fresh sushi Really cute decor   The place is big and so clean. There was no wait when we arrived at 5:45 pm on Thursday. The service was fast. Our food must have been served faster than McDonald's. Our favorite dishes were the super white tuna and ocean trout. Mmmmm!!! We will definitely go back again.
